item.title: Terri add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Terri add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Terri add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "Far away there in the sunshine are my highest aspirations. I may not reach them, but I can look up and see their beauty, believe in them, and try to follow where they lead." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Terri add a quote by Katherine Mansfield
item.description:
"Risk anything! Care no more for the opinion of others ... Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth."
(Journal entry, 14 October 1922)" -- Katherine Mansfield

item.title: Terri add a quote by J.M. Barrie
item.description: "Those who bring sunshine to the lives of others cannot keep it from themselves." -- J.M. Barrie

item.title: Terri add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "You must have chaos within you to give birth to a dancing star." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Terri add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "When you get into a tight place and everything goes against you until it seems that you cannot hold on for a minute longer, never give up then, for that is just the place and time when the tide will turn." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Terri add a quote by Harriet Beecher Stowe
item.description: "Once in an age God sends to some of us a friend who loves in us, not a false-imagining, an unreal character, but looking through the rubbish of our imperfections, loves in us the divine ideal of our nature,--loves, not the man that we are, but the angel that we may be." -- Harriet Beecher Stowe

item.title: Terri add a quote by Thomas Carlyle
item.description: "The block of granite which was an obstacle in the pathway of the weak becomes a stepping-stone in the pathway of the strong." -- Thomas Carlyle

item.title: Terri add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Develop an interest in life as you see it; the people, things, literature, music - the world is so rich, simply throbbing with rich treasures, beautiful souls and interesting people. Forget yourself." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Terri add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "All growth is a leap in the dark, a spontaneous unpremeditated act without the benefit of experience." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Terri add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "You gain strength, courage and confidence by every experience in which you really stop to look fear in the face. You are able to say to yourself, 'I have lived through this horror. I can take the next thing that comes along.' You must do the thing you think you cannot do." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Terri add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "Life was meant to be lived, and curiosity must be kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life." -- Eleanor Roosevelt
